subject: Design
title: Designing for 1,000 Years: Long-Term Thinking
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Designing for 1,000 Years: Long-Term Thinking.

hook.text: The Long Now Foundation is building a clock designed to run for 10,000 years. What can design learn from that?

buildup.text: Most products are designed for 2-5 years. Long-term design asks: what if we designed for centuries?

discovery.text: Japanese temples are rebuilt every 20 years using the same techniques ‚Äî designed for continuity, not permanence.

twist.text: Nuclear waste must be stored safely for 100,000 years. How do you design a warning sign for a future civilization?

climax.text: Long-term design forces us to think beyond ourselves ‚Äî designing for people who don't exist yet.

punchline.text: Building for the future means asking questions no one else dares.

quiz.question: What challenge does nuclear waste storage present to designers?
options: Creating warning systems that communicate across 100,000 years
